front.title: A Secure Selection and Filtering Mechanism for the Network Time Protocol with Chronos

abstract.t: The Network Time Protocol version 4 (NTPv4), as defined in RFC 5905, is the mechanism used by NTP clients to synchronize with NTP servers across the Internet. This document specifies an extension to the NTPv4 client, named Chronos, which is used as a "watchdog" alongside NTPv4, and provides improved security against time shifting attacks. Chronos involves changes to the NTP client's system process only. Since it does not affect the wire protocol, the Chronos mechanism is applicable to any current or future time protocol.
